name: update-assembly-info
description: Update assembly info of one or multiple projects
helpMarkDown: Having Problems? Please create an issue on our Github and we will try to help you.
author: Bool (by Sigma)

inputs.name: assemblyInfoFiles
inputs.label: Assembly Info
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the assembly info file(s). Variables can be used, eg. $(Build.SourcesDirectory). You can also use wildcards, eg. \*\*\AssemblyInfo.\* for all AssemblyInfo.* files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used including these task-specific variables:
  • $(Assembly.Company): The value provided for Company.
  • $(Assembly.Product): The value provided for Product.
  • $(Year): Provides the current year.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, eg. $(BuildConfiguration).

inputs.name: company
inputs.label: Company
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used.

inputs.name: product
inputs.label: Product
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used

inputs.name: copyright
inputs.label: Copyright
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, including these task-specific variables:
  • $(Assembly.Company): The value provided for Company.
  • $(Assembly.Product): The value provided for Product.
  • $(Year): Provides the current year.
Used togeather this could produce "Copyright © YourCompanyName 2017".

inputs.name: trademark
inputs.label: Trademark
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, including these task-specific variables:
  • $(Assembly.Company): The value provided for Company.
  • $(Assembly.Product): The value provided for Product.

inputs.name: fileVersionMajor
inputs.label: Major
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, eg. $(Build.BuildId).

inputs.name: fileVersionMinor
inputs.label: Minor
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, eg. $(Build.BuildId).

inputs.name: fileVersionBuild
inputs.label: Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, eg. $(Build.BuildId).

inputs.name: fileVersionRevision
inputs.label: Revision
inputs.helpMarkDown: Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, eg. $(Build.BuildId).

inputs.name: informationalVersion
inputs.label: Informational Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Left blank, the value is not updated. Variables can be used, inlcuding these task-specific variables:
  • $(Assembly.FileVersion): The assembly file version value.
  • $(Assembly.FileVersionMajor): The assembly file version major value. Requires Major to be specified.
  • $(Assembly.FileVersionMinor): The assembly file version minor value. Requires Minor to be specified.
  • $(Assembly.FileVersionBuild): The assembly file version build value. Requires Build to be specified.
  • $(Assembly.FileVersionRevision): The assembly file version revision value. Requires Revision to be specified.
